original: I can add many sentences in different languages.

original: My mom disapproves of him.

original: My sister likes melons and so do I.

original: Her house is across the river.
translated: Sa maison se situe de l'autre côté de la rivière.

original: Very simple was my explanation, and plausible enough—as most wrong theories are!

original: I wonder who liked my picture.

original: Are you quite certain about it?

original: Do you need some water?

original: I think Tom said his last name is Jackson.
translated: Je pense que Tom a dit que son nom est Jackson.

original: You've done a great job.
translated: Tu as fait de l’excellent boulot.

original: Nonsense!
translated: Conneries !

original: I'll vote for you.
translated: Je voterai pour toi.

original: You have foul breath.

original: I told you his name was Tom, didn't I?

original: Dinner is almost ready.

original: Why don't you admit your mistake?

original: You speak good English.

original: Can I put this on your finger?

original: I need money.

original: I want to keep doing this for as long as possible.

original: He is bright, and what is more, he is polite.

original: Me and him are friends.

original: We've had all kinds of weather over the past few days.

original: Tom and Mary were on the same wavelength.

original: This is very dangerous.

original: Beef is expensive nowadays.

original: Tom thought that Mary was alone.

original: I drive a jeep.

original: Your job is hanging by a thread.

original: We miss you.

original: I am playing video games.

original: The novel I'm writing next is set in a love hotel so I wanted to see what one actually looks like.
translated: Le prochain roman que j'écris se passe dans un love hotel c'est pour ça que je voulais savoir à quoi ça ressemblait.

original: The lawyer tried to discredit the witness.
translated: L'avocat a essayé de discréditer le témoin.

original: I lost my camera a little while ago.
translated: J'ai perdu mon appareil photo il y a un petit moment.

original: Don't get up.

original: Bon voyage!

original: Somebody's got to do it.

original: His sons do as they please.

original: I'm in Tehran.

original: I just try to do what I can.

original: We think that's a good thing.

original: I would like to eat a hot soup.

original: I've got to do this.

original: This is some kind of sign.

original: You need not have come so early.

original: They're up to no good.

original: Are you afraid of death?

translated: L'inspecteur fut accusé d'avoir dissimulé des preuves sur la scène du crime.

original: She's wearing fake nails.

original: I have a sore throat. Do you have a cough drop?

original: This is a very rare specimen.

original: I'm the one who should be doing this.

original: How about going to see a movie tonight?

original: What were you doing before this?

original: I advised him not to grieve over the past.

original: What a pity.

original: Oceans do not so much divide the world as unite it.
translated: Les océans divisent moins le monde qu'ils ne l'unissent.

original: I'm studying kabuki drama.
translated: J'étudie l'art dramatique du kabuki.

original: Everyone died.

original: I have never climbed Mt. Fuji.

original: There's a cat on the table.

original: I don't have a cat.

original: I want to be able to speak French like a native speaker.
translated: J'ai envie de savoir parler français comme un locuteur natif.

original: I must know where these quotations originate.

original: What a beautiful night!

original: I was lucky today.

original: We should do this.

original: We'll be working together.

original: The weather's good today.

original: I'm not joking.

original: That's a lot of translations.

original: She doesn't have any real friends.

original: I'm speechless.

original: Tom said everything he wanted to say.
translated: Tom à dit tout ce qu'il avait à dire.

original: I don't have anybody.

original: Metal cases are undoubtedly tougher, but much more expensive.
translated: Les valises métalliques sont sans aucun doute plus résistantes mais beaucoup plus onéreuses.

original: That's more than enough.

original: Tom is worried about his children's health.

original: She talked as she walked.

original: There was a traffic accident in front of the house yesterday.

original: When did he go to Europe?

original: Read it to me.

original: Tom is probably not happy right now.
translated: Tom n'est probablement pas heureux en ce moment.

original: He has in his possession films that were never distributed to cinemas to protect them against piracy.
translated: Il a des films jamais sortis dans les cinémas pour les protéger du piratage.

original: Things are improving.
translated: Les choses s'améliorent.

original: He is doing the homework.

original: The chess pieces are pawn, knight, bishop, rook, queen, and king.
translated: Les pièces d'échecs sont le pion, le chevalier, le fou, la tour, la reine et le roi.

original: And whether or not it is clear to you, no doubt the universe is unfolding as it should.
translated: Et que ça soit clair ou pas pour vous, il ne fait aucun doute que l'univers se déploie comme il devrait.

original: That man is Kenyan.
translated: Cet homme est kenyan.

original: A bunch of people were standing outside waiting.
translated: Un groupe de gens se tenaient à l'extérieur, à attendre.

original: I knew they were lying!

original: What does your spouse like to do that you don't like to do?

original: Enjoy your food.

original: Tom is taller than any of the other kids in his class.
translated: Tom est plus grand que les autres enfants de sa classe.

original: You don't seem very satisfied.
translated: Vous ne semblez pas très satisfaites.

original: Mary has French and German nationality.
translated: Marie a la nationalité française et allemande.

original: He lifted the weight without effort.

original: She listened to music for hours.
translated: Elle écoutait de la musique durant des heures.

original: They play together a lot.

original: I think Tom is in the front yard.

original: I waited for your call all day.

original: The ear canal sends sound waves to the eardrum.
translated: Le conduit auditif envoie les ondes sonores jusqu'au tympan.

original: We know it's important to you.

original: I only need one onion for this recipe.

original: I can't give it away to you; it's a secret.

original: This book is very popular among women.
translated: Ce livre est très populaire auprès des femmes.

original: It was a beautiful marriage proposal.

original: I still don't have enough money to buy that.
translated: Je n'ai toujours pas assez d'argent pour acheter ça.

original: I am shorter than you.

original: Who is in the house?

original: She put on her new dress for the party.
translated: Elle a mis sa nouvelle robe pour la fête.

original: Go to hell!

original: Since I had met him once before, I recognized him right away.
translated: Vu que je l'avais déjà rencontré, je l'ai reconnu directement.

original: What do you feed your dog?

original: I'm learning how to type.

original: The sisters are both blondes.

original: I turned red.

original: I'm outraged!

original: His father was a captain in the Royal Navy.
translated: Son père était capitaine dans la Marine Royale.

original: I'm sorry about last night.

original: He keeps his room clean.

original: Tom turned the water on.

original: There is no film in this camera.

original: If I had wings to fly, I would've gone to save her.

original: I didn't win.

original: There are a lot of people here today.

original: Do you know those men over there?

original: I have few books.

original: The King of France is bald.

original: He has overstepped his authority.

original: I'm the best.

original: People love to talk.

original: I'm rational.

original: He wears thick glasses.
translated: Il porte des verres épais.

original: Scream!

original: I want this dog.
translated: Je veux ce chien.

original: I had expected him at the meeting.
translated: J'avais espéré qu'il assisterait à la réunion.

original: I liked to make people laugh and that got me all the way to where I am now.
translated: J'ai aimé faire rire les hommes et cela m'a porté, tout le long du chemin, jusque là où je suis maintenant.

original: Tom helped me.

original: Go get some water.
translated: Allez chercher de l'eau !

original: We've tried everything.

original: We're not in the 80s anymore.

original: I haven't finished breakfast yet.

original: Keep it warm.

original: If you don't want to read, then don't read.

original: Why are you so reluctant?

original: Make it larger.

original: Birds learn to fly by instinct.

original: I left you a note.

original: Wealth begets power.

original: The rain just stopped, so let's leave.
translated: La pluie vient juste de cesser. Nous pouvons partir.

original: Do not tell me what to do.

original: What's Ido?

original: I like this dog.

original: My friend doesn't believe in ghosts.

original: The abacus is a Chinese invention.

original: Do you want to eat with us?

original: I can buy one.

original: There is nothing like a walk.

original: I like her all the better for that.

original: I'm going to take the dog to the vet.

original: I would be loved.

original: Keep the child away from the pond.

original: I want to find a box for this.

original: This man is Kenyan.
translated: Cet homme est kenyan.

original: If I knew her name and address, I could write to her.
translated: Si je savais son nom et son adresse, je pourrais lui écrire.

original: She's most happy when she's at home.
translated: Elle est plus qu'heureuse lorsqu'elle est chez elle.

original: What's your problem?

original: We're eating beans.

original: I prefer walking.

original: It looks as if it's going to be a nice day.

original: She avoided answering my questions.

original: Sign the guest book.
translated: Signez le registre des invités !

original: Nothing new under the sun.
translated: Rien n'est nouveau sous le soleil.

original: No, that's not the station.

original: One should love one's mother tongue.
translated: Il faut aimer sa langue maternelle.

original: I can't wait to shower.
translated: Je hâte de me doucher.

original: She can only trust him.
translated: Ce n'est qu'à lui qu'elle peut faire confiance.

original: We're not friends. We're acquaintances.

original: Don't forget to extinguish your cigarette.

original: I love thick, creamy mushroom soup.
translated: J'aime la soupe aux champignons épaisse et crémeuse.

original: I hope that what you are eating is healthy.
translated: J'espère que ce que tu es en train de manger est sain.

original: It's way past your bedtime.
translated: L'heure d'aller vous coucher est largement dépassée.

original: We have little time to waste.
translated: Nous avons peu de temps à perdre.

original: I don't think that we will be able to solve this problem by ourselves.

original: Who started Disneyland?

original: She's addicted to shopping.

original: They feel hungry.
translated: Elles ont faim.

original: Sami was honking at Layla.
translated: Sami klaxonnait Layla.

original: He promised not to do that any more.
translated: Il a promis de ne plus le faire.

original: She's going to be hungry.
translated: Elle aura faim.

original: There is a right time for everything.
translated: Il y a un temps pour tout.

original: "What's this?" asked Tony.
translated: « Qu'est-ce que c'est que ça ? » demanda Tony.

original: Can you spare me a few minutes? I'd like to have a word with you.
translated: Peux-tu me consacrer quelques minutes ? J'aimerais te dire un mot.

original: I think that he is from Japan.

original: Her father found a way to squash the scandal.

original: How long have you been in Australia?

original: She's strong-willed.
translated: Elle a une forte volonté.

original: She slept more than ten hours yesterday.
translated: Hier, elle a dormi plus de 10 heures.

original: I was trying to say something when you so rudely interrupted.
translated: J'essayais de dire quelque chose quand tu m'as si grossièrement interrompu.

original: That's what I got.
translated: C'est ce que j'ai reçu.

original: Take a shower.
translated: Va prendre une douche !

original: Do you play the trombone?
translated: Est-ce que tu joues du trombone ?

original: He gave away his entire fortune to an old friend's daughter, and expected nothing in return.
translated: Il a fait cadeau de toute sa fortune à la fille d'un vieil ami, et n'attendit rien en retour.

original: I'm often told I don't look good in a skirt.

original: This was my fault.
translated: C'était de ma faute.

original: He felled a tree.
translated: Il a abattu un arbre.

original: Tom doesn't talk much.
translated: Tom ne parle pas beaucoup.

original: I'm proud of you all.
translated: Je suis fière de vous toutes.

original: It occurred to me spontaneously.
translated: Cela m'est venu spontanément à l'esprit.

original: I was almost right.

original: Do men cry?

original: Don't take any notice of what he said.

original: I already did that.

original: What can she say to her?

original: Is he aware of the difficulty?

original: You'll feel better in a few hours.
translated: Tu te sentiras mieux dans quelques heures.

original: I'll have it up and running in no time.

original: It's settled then.
translated: C'est réglé, alors.

original: The investigation concluded that the police officer had done nothing wrong.
translated: L'enquête conclut que l'agent de police n'avait rien fait de répréhensible.

original: Kitty is 12 years old and she still cannot read.
translated: Kitty a 12 ans et elle ne peut toujours pas lire.

original: Don't forget to take an umbrella with you.
translated: N'oublie pas d'apporter un parapluie.

original: I travelled by myself.
translated: J'ai voyagé seul.

original: Help me lift the package.
translated: Aide-moi à soulever ce paquet.

original: The wicked witch cast a spell on the man and turned him into a bug.
translated: La méchante sorcière lança un sort sur l'homme et le transforma en insecte.

original: I'm not going to pass out.
translated: Je ne vais pas m'évanouir.

original: What're you all dressed up for?

original: He has put on weight recently.
translated: Il a grossi ces derniers temps.

original: His father asked everyone to be at home tomorrow.
translated: Son père a demandé à tout le monde d'être à la maison demain.

original: I met him the day before.

original: My brother's girlfriend has black hair and green eyes.
translated: La petite amie de mon frère a les cheveux noirs et les yeux verts.

original: If Tom were here, what would you say to him?
translated: Si Tom était là, qu'est-ce tu lui dirais ?

original: Beautiful monuments must be preserved.
translated: Les beaux monuments doivent être préservés.

original: I hate them all.
translated: Je les déteste tous.

original: Don't let them tell you you're crazy.
translated: Ne les laissez pas vous dire que vous êtes folles.

original: Jesus Christ warned that blasphemy against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.
translated: Jésus-Christ a averti que le blasphème contre le Saint-Esprit ne sera pas pardonné.

original: In that country the government controls prices.
translated: Dans ce pays, le gouvernement contrôle les prix.

original: The monks chanted a mantra in unison.
translated: Les moines chantaient un mantra à l'unisson.

original: The book you're looking for is on my desk.
translated: Le livre que tu cherches est sur mon bureau.

original: It's not funny! Stop it!
translated: Ce n'est pas marrant ! Arrête !

original: We were on the point of leaving when Tom arrived.
translated: Nous étions tout juste en train de partir lorsque Tom est arrivé.

original: I love fairy tales.
translated: J'adore les contes de fées.

original: I'm dizzy.
translated: J'ai la tête qui tourne.

original: "Would you like a drink?" "Oh yes, that's a great idea."
translated: « Voulez-vous boire quelque chose ? » « Oh oui, c'est une bonne idée. »

original: All the desk drawers were empty.
translated: Tous les tiroirs des bureaux étaient vides.

original: He told me that I should be more careful.
translated: Il m'a dit que je devrais être plus prudent.

original: Have you taken your medicine yet?
translated: Avez-vous déjà pris vos médicaments ?

original: Do whatever you want.
translated: Fais ce que tu veux.

original: Tom won't be able to drive for a while.
translated: Tom ne pourra pas conduire pendant un moment.

original: I just made it under the wire.

original: They shared the money.
translated: Ils partagèrent l'argent.

original: Trees lose their leaves quickly.
translated: Les arbres perdent rapidement leurs feuilles.

translated: Ma transition d'homme à femme se passe bien.

original: Give it to me, please.
translated: Donnez-le-moi, s'il vous plait.

translated: Personne n'a posé de question sur quoi que ce soit.

original: I just haven't gotten to it yet.

original: Did you write this fairy tale by yourself?

original: Do you like your classmates?

original: What has this got to do with us?

original: She's a soloist.
translated: Elle est soliste.

translated: Hé toi, ferme-la !

original: What are you learning from the teacher?
translated: Qu'apprends-tu de ton professeur ?

translated: Expliquez-la-moi.

original: I got what I asked for.
translated: J'ai obtenu ce que j'ai demandé.

original: Whatever you do, don't let Tom help you.
translated: Quoi que vous fassiez, ne laissez pas Tom vous aider.

original: Your smile always makes me happy.
translated: Ton sourire me rend toujours heureux.

original: Shame on you.
translated: Honte à toi !

original: What's the spelling of your family name?
translated: Quelle est l'orthographe de votre nom de famille ?

original: It's ideal weather for a picnic.
translated: Le temps est idéal pour un pique-nique.

original: Why are you always contradicting me? You cannot accept from time to time that I may be right?
translated: Pourquoi tu me contredis toujours? Tu ne peux pas accepter de temps en temps que j'ai peut-être raison?

original: The living conditions of Tom and Mary invoked pity in the eyes of their neighbors.
translated: Les conditions de vie de Tom et de Marie inspiraient de la pitié à leurs voisins.

original: You are as white as a sheet.
translated: Tu es blanc comme un cachet d'aspirine.

original: I'm not afraid of heights.
translated: Je n'ai pas le vertige.

original: I had nothing to do with that.
translated: Je n'eus rien à voir avec ça.

original: The cup broke.
translated: La coupe s'est brisée.

original: You should complement your nutrition with vitamins.
translated: Tu devrais compléter ton alimentation en vitamines.

original: I'm going to go buy a ticket, so please watch my bags for a minute.
translated: Je vais aller acheter un ticket, alors surveille mes sacs une minute, s'il te plaît.

original: He is trying to commit suicide.
translated: Il essaye de se suicider.

original: It's a beautiful sunset, isn't it?
translated: Joli coucher de soleil, n'est-ce pas ?

original: He is a VIP and we must treat him as such.
translated: C'est une personne très importante et nous devons le traiter comme tel.

original: I learned nothing from the teacher.
translated: Je n'ai rien appris de l'instituteur.

original: We can manage without you.
translated: On peut gérer sans toi.

original: You should go.
translated: Tu devrais y aller.

original: You must turn off the light before you go out.
translated: Il faut éteindre la lumière avant de sortir d'une pièce.

original: He has a huge cock.
translated: Il a un énorme braquemart.

original: Salmon lay their eggs in fresh water.
translated: Le saumon pond ses œufs en eau douce.

original: I have to get a new computer.
translated: Il me faut un nouvel ordinateur.

original: It's the first in a long series!
translated: C'est la première d'une longue série !

original: You should be more careful the next time.
translated: Vous devriez être plus prudents, la prochaine fois.

original: I've already made it.
translated: Je l'ai déjà faite.

original: How are my girls?
translated: Comment vont mes filles ?

original: Don't count on it.
translated: Ne compte pas dessus.

original: I didn't expect you to turn up here.
translated: Je ne pensais pas que vous apparaîtriez ici.

original: I'll be glad to.
translated: Oui, avec joie.

original: Can you tell the difference between granite and sandstone?
translated: Pouvez-vous faire la différence entre le granit et le grès ?

original: That museum has a wonderful collection of modern art.
translated: Ce musée a une magnifique collection d'art moderne.

original: I am married and I have a daughter.
translated: Je suis marié et j'ai une fille.

original: Tom unfolded his napkin.
translated: Tom déroula sa serviette.

original: When did you arrive?
translated: Quand es-tu arrivé ?

original: A trip to Hawaii will cost you about 200 dollars.
translated: Un voyage à Hawaii coûte environ 200 dollars.

original: He's fit for the loony bin.
translated: Il est bon pour l'asile.

original: I don't like being told what to do.
translated: Je n'aime pas qu'on me dise quoi faire.

original: Is there anything that I should not eat?
translated: Y a-t-il quelque chose que je ne devrais pas manger ?

original: That's not her husband.
translated: Ce n’est pas son mari.

original: Did they say why?
translated: Ont-elles dit pourquoi ?

original: I could not stop laughing.
translated: Je ne pus m'empêcher de rigoler.

original: Would you like to travel to the United States?
translated: Voudrais-tu voyager aux États-Unis ?

original: That is how it happened.
translated: C'est comme ça que c'est arrivé.

original: It's really cool here.
translated: C'est vraiment frais, ici.

original: Light the candle.
translated: Allume la bougie !

original: Tom is usually very quiet, isn't he?
translated: Tom est généralement très silencieux, n'est-ce pas ?

original: You look perfect.
translated: Tu as l'air parfait.

original: Let's try it with this one.
translated: Essayons avec celui-ci.

original: Can you see this?
translated: Est-ce que tu arrives à voir ça ?

original: Do you understand me?
translated: Me comprends-tu ?

original: We found out that he was her father.
translated: Nous avons découvert qu'il était son père.

original: Love is eternal as long as it lasts.
translated: L'amour est éternel tant qu'il dure.

original: I've remarried.
translated: Je me suis remariée.

original: Put your hat on.
translated: Mettez votre chapeau !

original: You have to do that whether you like it or not.
translated: Vous devez le faire que vous le vouliez ou non.

original: That man is Pedro.
translated: Cet homme c'est Pedro.

original: Tom lived in his car for a while after he broke up with Mary.
translated: Tom a vécu dans sa voiture un moment après avoir rompu avec Mary.

original: Singers use microphones to make their voices louder.
translated: Les chanteurs utilisent des microphones pour amplifier leurs voix.

original: Tom returned at half past six.
translated: Tom est rentré à 6:30.

original: Don't worry about the cost.
translated: Ne te soucie pas du coût !

original: What were we supposed to do?
translated: Qu'étions-nous supposés faire ?

original: I forgot her address.
translated: J'ai oublié son adresse.

original: I couldn't contain my anger.
translated: Je ne pouvais retenir ma colère.

original: I can't praise him enough.
translated: Je ne peux assez lui rendre grâce.

original: That would be unprofessional.
translated: Ce serait peu professionnel.

original: You've got a lot of nerve bringing me here under false pretenses.
translated: Tu ne manques pas d'air de m'attirer ici sous de faux prétextes.

original: The story turned my blood cold.
translated: Le récit m'a glacé le sang.

original: You seem to be depressed this morning. What's the matter?
translated: Tu sembles déprimé, ce matin. Que ce passe-t-il ?
